findings: Front tires have a tread depth of approximately 7/32 inches, which is nearing the recommended replacement threshold.
Front brake pads have a thickness of around 9-10 millimeters, indicating they are still in good condition.
Technician has identified a fault with the Vehicle Stability Control Module.
Vehicle is shaking significantly at idle.
Both motor mounts are not holding vacuum properly, requiring replacement.
services_performed: Inspection of tires, brakes, and vehicle Module fault
recommendations: Replacement of Vehicle Stability Control Module

concerns_and_estimates.concern: COMPLIMENTARY LAND ROVER MULTI POINT INSPECTION
CUSTOMER STATES RESET ALL TIRE PRESSURES

items.description: GUEST REPORTS CHECK ENGINE LIGHT IS COMING ON AND VEHICLE WILL NOT GO OVER 40MPH
items.comments: CHECK ENGINE LIGHT WAS NOT ON. CONNECTED TOPIX CLOUD AND HAVE FAULT CODE FOR QUIESCENT RELAY MODULE. RECOMMEND [Implied VSC Module Replacement]
FRONT WIPER BLADES STREAKING RECOMMEND REPLACEMENT
BOTH MOTOR MOUNTS ARE NOT HOLDING VACUUM CAUSING EXCESSIVE VIBRATIONS AT IDLE. RECOMMEND REPLACEMENT OF BOTH MOTOR MOUNTS

items.description: Inspect overall tire wear and condition

passed_inspections: Inspect heat and air conditioning operation
Inspect headlights, low and high beam operation
Inspect taillight, turn signal, side marker and license plate lights
Inspect taillight, turn signal and side marker assemblies for cracks and damage
Inspect engine cooling system for leaks
Inspect axles, driveshaft(s), u-joints and CV joints/boots
